t: Jeremiah 12
Jeremiah’s Prayer

Righteous*pn are You, O Lord,*s that I would plead my*i case with You; Indeed*ln I would discuss matters of justice with You: Why*ln has the way of the wicked prospered? Why*iln are all those who deal in treachery at ease?
You*ln have planted them, they have also taken root; They*ln grow, they have even produced fruit. You*ln are near to their lips But*ln far from their mind.
But*ln You know me, O Lord;*s You*ln see me; And*ln You examine my heart’s attitude*i toward You. Drag*ln them off like sheep for the slaughter And*ln set them apart for a day of carnage!

How*ln long is the land to mourn And*ln the vegetation of the countryside to wither? For*ln the wickedness of those who dwell in it, Animals*ln and birds have been snatched away, Because*ln men*i have said, “He will not see our latter ending.”
“If*ln you have run with footmen and they have tired you out, Then*ln how can you compete with horses? If*ln you fall down in a land of peace, How*ln will you do in the thicket of the Jordan?

For*ln even your brothers and the household of your father, Even*ln they have dealt treacherously with you, Even*ln they have cried aloud after you. Do*ln not believe them, although they may say nice things to you.”
God’s Answer
“I*pn have forsaken My house, I*ln have abandoned My inheritance; I*ln have given the beloved of My soul Into*ln the hand of her enemies.
My*ln inheritance has become to Me Like*ln a lion in the forest; She*ln has roared against Me; Therefore*ln I have come to hate her.
Is*ln My inheritance like a speckled bird of prey to Me? Are*ln the birds of prey against her on every side? Go,*ln gather all the beasts of the field, Bring*ln them to devour!
Many*ln shepherds have ruined My vineyard, They*ln have trampled down My field; They*ln have made My pleasant field A*ln desolate wilderness.
It*ln has been made a desolation, Desolate,*ln it mourns before Me; The*ln whole land has been made desolate, Because*ln no man lays it to heart.
On*ln all the bare heights in the wilderness Destroyers*ln have come, For*ln a sword of the Lord*s is devouring From*ln one end of the land even to the other; There*ln is no peace for anyone.
They*ln have sown wheat and have reaped thorns, They*ln have strained themselves to no profit. But*ln be ashamed of your harvest Because*ln of the fierce anger of the Lord.”*s

Thus*p says the Lord*s concerning all My wicked neighbors who strike at the inheritance with which I have endowed My people Israel, “Behold I am about to uproot them from their land and will uproot the house of Judah from among them.
And it will come about that after I have uprooted them, I will again have compassion on them; and I will bring them back, each one to his inheritance and each one to his land.
Then if they will really learn the ways of My people, to swear by My name, ‘As the Lord*s lives,’ even as they taught My people to swear by Baal, they will be built up in the midst of My people.
But if they will not listen, then I will uproot that nation, uproot and destroy it,” declares the Lord.*s
